headline: Looking At The Narrative For UnitedHealth Group UNH After Shifting Earnings Recovery Expectations
summary: UnitedHealth Group’s fair value estimate has been nudged up from about US$389 to roughly US$392 per share, as recent Street research has turned somewhat more constructive on the company’s long term earnings recovery story. A stable discount rate around 7.0% and a slightly firmer revenue growth outlook, supported by views on Medicare Advantage, Medicaid margin normalization, and Optum restructuring progress, are helping to anchor this updated pricing narrative. Stay tuned to see how you can...

headline: Is UnitedHealth Group (UNH) Attractive After A 33% One Year Share Price Decline
summary: If you have been wondering whether UnitedHealth Group shares still offer fair value after recent volatility, this breakdown will help you frame the trade off between price and quality. The stock last closed at US$336.40, with returns of 2.3% over the past 7 days and 1.7% over the last 30 days, alongside a 32.9% decline over 1 year and a 27.5% decline over 3 years. Recent headlines around UnitedHealth Group have focused on the stock's longer term pullback and what that means for investor...

headline: Berkshire Hathaway dethrones Allianz as world’s largest insurer
summary: Investing.com -- Berkshire Hathaway has claimed the top spot in AM Best’s ranking of the world’s 25 largest insurance companies by non-banking assets, surpassing Allianz SE, the global rating agency announced on Monday.

headline: UnitedHealth Sinks 34.5% in a Year: Buy the Dip Before Q4 Earnings?
summary: UNH shares are down 34.5% in a year as costs and margins bite, with Q4 earnings and 2026 guidance set to test whether value is emerging.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Jumps Into Top Spot on AM Best’s Largest Insurer Ranking by Nonbanking Assets; UnitedHealth Group Retains Lead Position by Net Premiums Written
summary: OLDWICK, N.J., January 05, 2026--Berkshire Hathaway Inc. moved ahead of Allianz SE to claim the top spot in AM Best’s ranking of the world’s 25 largest insurance companies by nonbanking assets, at $1.15 trillion, while UnitedHealth Group Inc. held onto its top spot by net premiums written (NPW) for an 11th straight year, growing NPW by 6.2% in 2024 to $308.8 billion.

raw.headline: Berkshire Hathaway Jumps Into Top Spot on AM Best’s Largest Insurer Ranking by Nonbanking Assets; UnitedHealth Group Retains Lead Position by Net Premiums Written
raw.summary: OLDWICK, N.J., January 05, 2026--Berkshire Hathaway Inc. moved ahead of Allianz SE to claim the top spot in AM Best’s ranking of the world’s 25 largest insurance companies by nonbanking assets, at $1.15 trillion, while UnitedHealth Group Inc. held onto its top spot by net premiums written (NPW) for an 11th straight year, growing NPW by 6.2% in 2024 to $308.8 billion.

headline: SGA Global Growth Strategy Maintained Its Stake in UnitedHealth (UNH)
summary: Sustainable Growth Advisers (SGA), an investment management company, released its third-quarter investor letter for its “Global Growth Strategy.” A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. The portfolio returned -2.3% (Gross) and -2.5% (Net) in the third quarter, compared to a 7.6% return for the MSCI ACWI and a 9.0% return for the MSCI ACWI […]
